problem.markdown:
>>A more flexible building will deflect ____ a stiffer building:<<
This problem has been reconfigured to give full credit to anyone who submitted an answer (right or wrong) as the question contained an error when the course ran.
(x) less than (x) more than (x) the same as
[explanation] The answer is 'more than'.
Stiffness is a measure of the amount of deflection expected under a given load. A flexible system will deflect more than a more stiff system. Taller, slender systems tend to be more flexible than shorter, wider systems. [explanation]
